intro: Aglaia elliptica var. ceramica, commonly known as Ceramica Aglaia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to the Indonesian island of Ceram and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and fragrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its fruits are woody capsules containing several seeds, and it is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
